alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 21 at 5:04PM CDT until May 21 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Illinois, including the following counties, Madison, Monroe and Saint Clair. Portions of east central Missouri, including the following counties and independent city, Jefferson, Saint Louis and Saint Louis City. * WHEN...Until 615 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 504 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... St. Louis, Belleville, Wildwood, Ballwin, Granite City, O`Fallon, Kirkwood, East St. Louis, Collinsville, Webster Groves, Arnold, Manchester, Fairview Heights, Clayton, Cahokia, Swansea, Glen Carbon, Crestwood, Town and Country and Eureka.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
